entries.meaning: A storyteller, especially a person noted for telling stories with skill and wit.
examples: He was tempted to try the last door—to look into the room of evil fame; but he reflected that this would be indiscreet, since Colonel Capadose handled the brush—as a raconteur—with such freedom. There might be a ghost and there might not; but the Colonel himself, he inclined to think, was the most mystifying figure in the house.

verbs.description: raconteur (third-person singular simple present raconteurs, present participle raconteuring, simple past and past participle raconteured)

entries.meaning: To make witty remarks or stories.
